sentence.Network_en: Big credits were given to East Germany by successive West German governments.

sentence.Network_en: Their unit was shelling the German lines only seven miles away.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French germain, from Latin germanus 'genuine, of the same parents'

entry.tran: 德国的；德国人的；德语的
entry.def: German means belonging or relating to Germany.
German is the language used in Germany, Austria, and parts of Switzerland.

example.ex: I heard a very angry man talking in German.
example.tran: 我听到一个怒不可遏的人说着德语。

means.word_mean: 2. the standard German language; developed historically from West Germanic
1. of or pertaining to or characteristic of Germany or its people or language;
2. of a more or less German nature; somewhat German;

Sentence.sentence: Before the War, much of Britain's food was imported and when German U-boats began attacking ships bringing food to the country, Britain went on rations (配给).
The German authorities are sending investigators to discover the cause of the plane crash late yesterday on the island of Tenerife.
The plane, a Boeing 737, taking German holiday makers to the island crashed into a hillside as it circled while preparing to land
